website_summaries.verdict: Plenty of competing DIY cameras offer more features minus SimpliSafe's monthly fees. Skip SimpliCam.
pros: SimpliSafe's $100 SimpliCam is an affordable DIY indoor security camera that you can add to an existing SimpliSafe system -- or use as a standalone camera
cons: SimpliSafe charges an optional $5 per month for very basic features, like event-based cloud video recording and storage and the ability to view the live feed on the web app

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it.

customer_reviews.title: Just about sent it back.
customer_reviews.text: It took 15 attempts to activate the camera. They tell you to scan the QR code from 1-2 feet away. Only worked when I moved it to 2" away and slowly backed it up with my left foot in the air and one eye closed and humming Post Malone's Same Bitches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I recommend them every chance I get
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big Simplisafe fan, I recommend them every chance I get, but This is a poor product from Simplisafe. customer_reviews.title: Camera Issue
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this security system because the camera will not maintain an internet connection. I have been in contact with vendor and was told to just return the system. I'm very disappointed that I have to start looking for a different system again...

customer_reviews.title: The camera seems to work fine, but having it sync to my account causes ...
customer_reviews.text: My issues are more with the service than the camera itself. The camera seems to work fine, but having it sync to my account causes trouble and find i have to keep unplugging and re-adding to my account to re-sync. I also don't like that it wasn't until after I purchased the camera I discovered it was actually an extra fee for the camera to turn on automatically when the alarm is triggered and record, so for now I have a way to stream live when an event is triggered, but no recording until I decide it is or isn't worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Cam, but not Simplisafe
customer_reviews.text: We have a Simplisafe alarm system and have been pleased with it. However, the Simplisafe Cam proved to be troublesome and problematic. Performance on motion detection was very bad. It may have even needed restarting at times because it wasn't picking any motion at all on several occasions. We purchased a wired RING cam to replace this and there is a huge difference. Ring Cam has excellent motion detection—even through the screen of patio where we have one installed. The Simplisafe cam had issues with that. Also, the RING camera is up and running 100% of the time—very reliable, very sensitive, unlike the Simplisafe cam. Avoid Simplisafe for camera technology at the moment, but their alarm system is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesy

customer_reviews.title: Adequate {but barely)
customer_reviews.text: Second camera set up with the simplisafe system .... Easy to set up and get going. Works well but feels like 2008 technology with only a wired power source and no panning. Low light video is very weak. So why did I add a second? I've had and even very satisfied with the simplisafe system for over six years. Price is great and the monitoring service is fast and has always been spot on. Hopefully simplisafe can get their act together with a better camera system in the future but in the meantime......This one is adequate. {Barely).
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have DSL or Satellite - Requires 5Mb WiFi Upload Speed
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm really happy with Simplisafe, but these cameras are useless if you have DSL or Satellite. They disconnect immediately on my system. Tech Support told me that you have to have a 5Mb/sec upload speed. That rules out DSL and Satellite connections and many cable connections. That fact should be clearly stated in their sales literature. The cameras are only 720P so there really shouldn't be an issue. No way to slow down the refresh rate and apparently no compression. All of my other IP cameras work fine with my DSL. For Simplisafe -- Great idea, bad execution. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Setup could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The sound isn't very good, and the setup is a pain in the neck if you want to change one you have already setup, plus getting it to read the QR code during setup is a total pain in the neck. I'd prefer being able to plug it into a computer and access it with a browser and conduct manual entry of the settings. Once setup, they do work but don't always connect.

I have motion sensors and email alerts turned off, but the cameras are detecting every bit of mtion there is. And I have an inbox full of email alerts. So annoying. Left a tech support message with Simpoisafe 24 hours ago and still no response. What lousy junk.

Paid the $4.99 a month for the ability to see it online through the app. No working even through it shows it is set up and connected to wi-fi. I guess it will be a deterrent, but not more than that.
customer_reviews.author: DBF

customer_reviews.title: Simplisafe replaced camera purchased from you due to malfunction
customer_reviews.text: It would not pair with my existing Simplisafe system. I called Simplisafe and they replaced camera I purchased from you with another properly working camera.

customer_reviews.title: Pos , not so fast
customer_reviews.text: Got it.. followed instructions, got blue light.. connection error. Rebooted router and camera. Still nothing. Looks like a total pos. Update: rebooted again. Unit updated itself and now all is well.
